page.title: 18CIMLA CARNIVAL
page.content: Cimla Carnival is held annually on Cimla Common in August. The carnival is held to raise money for various local charities. The carnival begins with a procession of floats led by the Cimla Promenaders (the local children's jazz band). There are floats for Cubs and Scouts, Hula Dancers, Keep-Fit, the Fire Service and St. Trinians. There is a special float for the Carnival Queen and her attendants .There are stalls which sell cakes, sweets, toys, plants, books and bric-a-brac.Several raffles are held during the carnival. The money from these is also donated to charities.Activities at the carnival include a soccer match, tug of war, a fancy dress competition and the chance to throw wet sponges at a volunteer held in the stocks.
